verse: It was the tenth year [since King Jehoiachin’s exile (1:2)], in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month [January 7, 587 bc]. The ·Lord spoke his word [word of the Lord came] to me, saying:
“·Human [Son of man; 2:1], ·look [set your face] toward the king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and all Egypt.
Say: ‘This is what the Lord God says:
Then all the people who live in Egypt will know that I am the Lord.

When their hands grabbed you, you ·splintered [broke] and tore open their shoulders. When they leaned on you, you ·broke [splintered] and made all their ·backs twist [or legs go wobbly; or loins shake].
“‘So this is what the Lord God says: I will ·cause an enemy to attack [bring a sword against] you and kill your people and animals.
Egypt will become an ·empty desert [desolate wasteland]. Then they will know that I am the Lord.

I am against you and your ·rivers [streams]. I will destroy the land of Egypt and make it an ·empty desert [desolate wasteland] from Migdol [in the north] to Aswan [in the south], all the way to the border of Cush [Ethiopia].
No ·person or animal will walk [foot of man shall pass through it and no foot of beast will pass] through it, and no one will live in Egypt for forty years.

I will make the land of Egypt ·the most deserted country of all [a desolation among desolate lands]. Her cities will be ·the most deserted of all [a desolation among] ruined cities for forty years. I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, spreading them among the countries.
“‘This is what the Lord God says: After forty years I will gather Egypt from the nations where they have been scattered.

I will ·bring back the Egyptian captives [restore the fortunes of Egypt] and make them return to ·southern Egypt [the land of Pathros], to the land ·they came from [of their ancestry/origin]. They will become a ·weak [lowly; insignificant] kingdom there.
It will be the ·weakest [most lowly/insignificant] kingdom, and it will never again ·rule [exalt itself over] other nations. I will make it so ·weak [small] it will never again rule over the nations.

The Israelites will never again ·depend on [rely on; have confidence in] Egypt. Instead, ·Egypt’s punishment [it] will remind the Israelites of their sin in turning to Egypt for help. Then they will know that I am the Lord God.’”

It was the twenty-seventh year [since King Jehoiachin’s exile (1:2)], in the first month, on the first day of the month [April 26, 571 bc]. The ·Lord spoke his word [word of the Lord came] to me, saying:

“·Human [Son of man; 2:1], Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made his army ·fight [labor] hard against Tyre. Every soldier’s head was rubbed bare, and every shoulder was rubbed raw. But Nebuchadnezzar and his army gained ·nothing [or no wages] from ·fighting Tyre [the labor he performed against her].

So this is what the Lord God says: I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. He will ·take away Egypt’s people and its wealth and its treasures [carry off its wealth and loot and plunder it] as pay for his army.
I am giving Nebuchadnezzar the land of Egypt as ·a reward [compensation] for working hard for me, says the Lord God.

“·At that time [On that day] I will ·make Israel grow strong again [cause a horn to sprout for the house of Israel; Ps. 132:17], and I will ·let you, Ezekiel, speak to them [give you an open mouth among them]. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”
